definition: a blast furnace (in modern times)/a draft assisted furnace for smelting metals
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: The paper introduces the nickel smelting blast furnace control system.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了某镍冶炼厂鼓风炉控制系统。

sentences.english: We can extract iron from haematite by heating it with carbon in a blast furnace.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把赤铁矿和碳在鼓风炉内一起加热来提取铁。

sentences.english: These plants would then be burned in blast furnaces in order to eliminate the toxic elements.
sentences.chinese: 之后这些植物被投进鼓风炉来消除有毒元素。

sentences.english: Coke is used predominantly as a fuel reluctant in the blast furnace.
sentences.chinese: 焦炭最初是在鼓风炉里作为助燃剂使用。

sentences.english: A program for material balance calculation in copper smelting with blast furnace has been studied in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 研究编制了密闭鼓风炉炼铜物料平衡电算程序。

sentences.english: After improvement of insulation on blast furnace front bed, much better results are achieved.
sentences.chinese: 通过对鼓风炉前床进行保温改造，取得了较好的效果。

sentences.english: The lead paste is then smelted in a blast furnace.
sentences.chinese: 铅团在鼓风炉中被溶解。

definition: a forced draft (of wind, for smelting metal)/blast (in blast furnace)/bellows/to draw air using bellows
